meta.title: RWAV Strategic Plan 2026-2030
meta.subtitle: Preparing a Bold Agenda for Rural Health Workforce Transformation
meta.author: Carlorbiz Strategic Consulting

currentState.headline: From Recruitment Agency to Systems Coordinator
currentState.description: RWAV currently operates as a government-funded workforce placement service, competing with other agencies for limited recruitment success. This model focuses on individual placements rather than systemic solutions, creates dependency on government funding cycles, limits strategic influence and cross-sector collaboration, and underutilises RWAV's unique neutral position and established relationships.
painPoints: Bums-on-seats approach fails to address root causes
Limited strategic influence beyond placement metrics
Competing with other agencies rather than coordinating

futureVision.headline: Rural Victoria's Trusted Systems Coordinator
futureVision.description: The transformation positions RWAV as rural Victoria's trusted systems coordinator, using data intelligence and coalition leadership—leveraging the trust the community and stakeholders already have—to drive retention, workforce planning, and health system reform. This addresses the coordination crisis while establishing sustainable revenue streams aligned with stakeholder needs.
aspirations: Central intelligence hub for rural health workforce coordination
Convener of cross-sector partnerships and coalitions
Policy influencer backed by robust data and community mandate
Financially sustainable through ethical revenue diversification

requiredDecisions.title: Strategic Direction Approval
requiredDecisions.description: Endorse the three-pillar transformation framework (DOERS, DRIVERS, ENABLERS)

requiredDecisions.title: Pilot Program Authorisation
requiredDecisions.description: Approve three-region pilot implementation with allocated resources (Bendigo, Gippsland Lakes, Mallee)

requiredDecisions.title: Financial Strategy Commitment
requiredDecisions.description: Support revenue diversification targeting 25-30% non-government funding by 2030

requiredDecisions.title: Cultural Safety Mandate
requiredDecisions.description: Approve mandatory ACCHO leadership requirements in all initiatives

requiredDecisions.title: Implementation Timeline Authorisation
requiredDecisions.description: Authorise immediate commencement of Phase 1 foundation building (2026)

keyStatistics.label: See poor coordination as significant barrier
keyStatistics.insight: Overwhelming mandate for coordination leadership role

keyStatistics.label: Believe coordination could solve majority of problems
keyStatistics.insight: Clear market opportunity for coordination services

keyStatistics.label: See health organisation partnerships as positive
keyStatistics.insight: Strong willingness to invest in partnership facilitation

keyStatistics.label: Cite lack of community input as barrier
Willing to contribute to workforce solutions

communityWillingness.action: Talk to family and friends about health workforce importance
Advocate for funding and policy changes
Pursue a career in health care
Participate in local community health worker program
Volunteer to support the health workforce
Donate to organisations supporting health workforce
Host community event to raise awareness

stakeholderQuotes.quote: Health professionals need peers… Priority should be in supporting the building of one workforce that works across the various services in rural areas.
Stop stealing from each other and share resources.
I don't understand why every state Rural Workforce Agency is so different with services. QLD services are far better for Rural General Practice than Victoria.
As a health professional and as a carer in rural/regional Australia, we need to bring health care to the patient and their families.
Tax deduction for rural doctors: 20% for MMM3, 30% for MMM4, 40% for MMM5, 50% for MMM6-7.

doers.title: DOERS
doers.subtitle: Frontline Impact Through Strategic Partnerships
doers.objective: Deliver measurable workforce and health outcomes through coordinated partner networks rather than direct service delivery.

initiatives.name: Retention Excellence Hubs
initiatives.description: Multi-organisational coordination centres addressing community input barriers
initiatives.impact: Addresses the 72% who identify lack of community input as barrier

initiatives.name: Community Map Platform
initiatives.description: Real-time workforce intelligence system providing early warning and strategic planning capability
initiatives.impact: Enables data-driven coordination for 91% coordination barrier

initiatives.name: Cultural Safety Integration
initiatives.description: Mandatory ACCHO leadership in all initiatives, addressing First Nations workforce priorities

initiatives.name: Rural Health Innovation Partnerships
initiatives.description: Facilitating the 92% who see health partnerships as positive impact
initiatives.impact: Drives cross-sector collaboration and service innovation

successMetrics.metric: 15% increase in rural health workforce retention

doers.stakeholderEvidence: Health professionals need peers… priority should be in supporting the building of one workforce that works across the various services in rural areas.

drivers.title: DRIVERS
drivers.subtitle: Systems Change and Strategic Influence
drivers.objective: Lead policy reform and systems coordination addressing root causes of rural health workforce challenges.

initiatives.name: Rural Health Coalition Leadership
initiatives.description: Convening cross-sector partnerships for systems reform
initiatives.impact: Leverages 92% partnership support for policy influence

initiatives.name: Evidence-Based Policy Advocacy
initiatives.description: Using Community Map data for strategic government engagement
initiatives.impact: Transforms data into actionable policy recommendations

initiatives.name: Multi-Regional Coordination
initiatives.description: Facilitating resource sharing and collaborative service delivery

initiatives.name: Innovation Facilitation
initiatives.description: Supporting technology adoption and service model innovation
initiatives.impact: Drives continuous improvement and best practice sharing

drivers.stakeholderEvidence: Development of service hubs in every 50km radius… Advocate for and promote multi-disciplinary General Practice in rural areas.

enablers.title: ENABLERS
enablers.subtitle: Organisational Transformation and Sustainability
enablers.objective: Build internal capability and financial sustainability to support coordination leadership role.

initiatives.name: Revenue Diversification
initiatives.description: Ethical revenue streams aligned with coordination mission
initiatives.impact: Reduces government dependency, enables strategic autonomy

initiatives.name: Data Intelligence Capability
initiatives.description: Advanced analytics and predictive modelling expertise
initiatives.impact: Enables evidence-based coordination and policy influence

initiatives.name: Partnership Infrastructure
initiatives.description: Systems and processes for multi-organisational coordination

initiatives.name: Cultural Transformation
initiatives.description: From service delivery to strategic leadership organisational culture
initiatives.impact: Aligns team mindset with transformation vision

enablers.stakeholderEvidence: Personal stories reinforce commitment: 'As a health professional and as a carer in rural/regional Australia, we need to bring health care to the patient and their families.'

overview.title: Three-Community Strategic Pilot Program
overview.subtitle: Testing Transformation Through Targeted Implementation
overview.purpose: Test and refine RWAV's transformation model through intensive implementation in three diverse rural communities, providing evidence base for statewide rollout and Board confidence in strategic direction.
overview.investment: Dedicated resources for intensive community engagement, platform development, and outcome measurement

communities.name: Bendigo Region
communities.firstNationsContext: Dja Dja Wurrung country with active ACCHO presence

communities.name: Gippsland Lakes Region
communities.firstNationsContext: Gunaikurnai country requiring authentic ACCHO partnership

communities.name: Mallee Region
communities.firstNationsContext: Wergaia country with historical workforce access inequities

phase1.name: Community Engagement and Baseline
activities: Formal agreements with community stakeholders and health services
ACCHO partnership establishment with clear leadership protocols
Community steering committee formation with diverse representation
Baseline workforce data collection and gap analysis

phase2.name: Platform Development and Testing
activities: Early warning indicator development and testing
User training and feedback collection processes

phase3.name: Service Integration and Expansion
activities: Full coordination service implementation across all workforce categories
Recruitment coordination and IMG pathway establishment
Professional development and support program delivery

phase4.name: Evaluation and Scaling Preparation
activities: Quantitative outcome measurement across workforce and community indicators
Qualitative evaluation through stakeholder interviews and focus groups
Financial sustainability assessment and revenue model validation
Scalability analysis and statewide implementation planning

successCriteria: Demonstrated workforce outcome improvements in all three communities
Stakeholder satisfaction scores >80% across all categories
Financial sustainability model validation with revenue stream evidence
Cultural safety protocol effectiveness and First Nations partner satisfaction
Scalability framework development with clear implementation pathway

overview.title: Financial Diversification Strategy
overview.subtitle: Ethical Revenue Framework for Sustainable Transformation
principles: Enhance rather than compromise RWAV's primary mission
Provide genuine value to rural communities and healthcare professionals
Support long-term sustainability without short-term exploitation
Align with RWAV's values of partnership, collaboration, and community focus

revenueStreams.name: Data Intelligence Services
revenueStreams.description: Community Map subscriptions for health services and government, workforce analytics and predictive modelling services, custom research and analysis for policy development
examples: Health service subscription to workforce dashboard

revenueStreams.name: Coordination Administration
revenueStreams.description: Multi-site supervision program administration, cross-regional partnership facilitation services, coalition secretariat and project management
examples: PHN contracting RWAV to coordinate regional initiatives
Multi-service organisation paying for coordination platform access

revenueStreams.name: Strategic Consultation
revenueStreams.description: Rural health system design consultation, workforce planning and retention strategy development, cultural safety and community engagement expertise
examples: Regional health service commissioning workforce strategy
Training provider seeking community engagement consultation
Interstate RWA requesting best practice advice

revenueStreams.name: Innovation Partnerships
revenueStreams.description: Technology company partnerships for rural health solutions, sponsored coordination of international medical graduate pathways, corporate partnership facilitation aligned with rural health needs
examples: Tech company sponsoring Community Map feature development
IMG recruitment agency paying coordination fees

year1.title: Foundation Building
milestones: Community Map beta revenue model tested

riskMitigation: Phased revenue diversification with government funding maintained during transition
Conservative projections with multiple revenue stream testing
Strict ethical guidelines ensuring data privacy and community consent
Regular review of revenue activities alignment with organisational values

years4_5.title: Leadership Consolidation
focus: Regional coordination leadership established across Victoria
Sustainable revenue model achieved (25-30% non-government funding)
System change impact measurement and reporting
Long-term strategic planning for next transformation phase
keyDeliverables: Rural health coordination model recognised nationally
